danfulea.phys.egs

Class PEGS4A

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.phys.egs.PEGS4A

  • public class PEGS4A
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is designed to initialize and perform PEGS specific tasks in order to prepare medium input data for EGS (Electron Gamma Shower). Based on work done by SLAC (Stanford Linear Accelerator Center) and EGSnrc developers.
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 16 AUG. 2005

      • plotGamma

        public static void plotGamma(double low,
                             double high)
        Build data required to plot photon cross sections in range [low energy, high energy].
        Parameters:
        low - low energy in MeV
        high - high energy in MeV

      • getGammaCS

        public static double[] getGammaCS(double E)
        Called by plotGamma. Given energy E, it computes cross sections for specific processes: Photo-electric effect, Compton scattering, Pair production, Coherent (Rayleigh) scattering and return the array of cross sections in cm^2/g.
        Parameters:
        E - E in MeV
        Returns:
        the result

      • getEPCS

        public static double[] getEPCS(double E)
        Called by plotEP. Given energy E, it computes cross sections for specific processes: Bremsstrahlung production, Moller interaction, Bhabha interaction, Annihilation process and return the array of cross sections in cm^2/g.
        Parameters:
        E - E in MeV
        Returns:
        the result

      • getTotalCrossSections

        public static double[] getTotalCrossSections(double E)
        Retrieve total cross sections for electrons, positrons and photons at a specific energy. It also give the appropriate branching ratios
        Parameters:
        E - E
        Returns:
        the result

      • getVfuns

        public static double[] getVfuns(double E)

        Parameters:
        E - E
        Returns:
        the result

      • preinit

        public static void preinit(java.lang.String med,
                           int nelem,
                           double rhoe,
                           java.lang.String[] asy,
                           double[] rhozz,
                           double[] pzee)
        Pre-initialization method to be called first for "manual" medium selection.
        Parameters:
        med - medium name
        nelem - nelem number of elements in this medium (mixture)
        rhoe - rhoe medium density in g/cm^3
        asy - is the name of each individual element (match the ASSYM table, see PEGS4)
        rhozz - rhozz is the partial density of each individual element (fraction by weight)
        pzee - this is just 0 here, we use rhozz instead.

      • init_pegs4

        public static void init_pegs4()
        Initialize PEGS4 for material creation.

      • init_pegs4_exact

        public static void init_pegs4_exact()
        Initialize PEGS4 for computing cross section and plotting charts. It performs exact calculations of electrons, positrons and gamma functions.

      • LAY

        public static void LAY()
        Called by init_pegs4. PRODUCES DECK OF MATERIAL DEPENDENT DATA.

      • PWLF1

        public static void PWLF1(java.lang.String NI,
                         int NIMX,
                         double XL,
                         double XU,
                         double XR,
                         double EP,
                         double[] ZTHR,
                         double[] ZEP,
                         int NIP,
                         java.lang.String XFUN,
                         java.lang.String XFI,
                         java.lang.String AX,
                         java.lang.String BX,
                         int NALM,
                         int NFUN,
                         java.lang.String AF,
                         java.lang.String BF,
                         java.lang.String VFUNS)
        Called by init_pegs4. PWLF1 IS A ROUTINE WHICH WILL FIT UP TO 10(CURRENTLY) FUNCTIONS SIMULTANEOUSLY ON AN INTERVAL (XL,XU) OF THE INDEPENDENT VARIABLE X OF THE FUNCTIONS. THE FIT IS A PIECEWISE LINEAR FUNCTION OF XFUN(X). XFI IS THE INVERSE FUNCTION OF XFUN. THE SUBINTERVALS ARE CHOSEN OF UNIFORM WIDTH IN XFUN(X) AND SUFFICIENT OF THEM ARE CHOSEN SO THAT THE FIT GIVES A RELATIVE ERROR[EP FOR ALL THE FUNCTIONS OVER ALL THE SUBINTERVALS.
        Parameters:
        NI - ON RETURN IS NUMBER OF SUBINTERVALS USED FOR THE FIT.
        NIMX - NIMX
        XL - LOWER LIMIT OF INTERVAL ON WHICH TO FIT THE FUNCTIONS.
        XU - UPPER LIMIT
        XR - VALUE OF X WHICH WILL BE FORCED TO BE A SUBINTERVAL BOUNDARY, IF ONE WANTS AN EXACT FIT OF THE FUNCTIONS AT A PARTICULAR POINT, XR SHOULD BE SET TO THAT VALUE.
        EP - THE MAXIMUM RELATIVE ERROR ALLOWED THE FIT.
        ZTHR - ZTHR
        ZEP - ZEP
        NIP - THE MINUIMUM NUMBER OF POINTS INTERIOR TO (XL,XU) AT WHICH THE FIT IS TO BE TESTED FOR RELATIVE ERROR VS. EP.
        XFUN - A FUNCTION OF X OVER WHICH IT IS HOPED THE FUNCTIONS TO BE FIT ARE MORE LINEAR THAN OVER X. XFUN IS EXPECTED TO BE MONOTONICALLY INCREASING IN X.
        XFI - THE INVERSE OF XFUN. THAT IS XFI(XFUN(X))=X.
        AX - COEFFICIENT USED TO DETERMINE WHICH SUBINTERVAL A VALUE OF X IS IN.
        BX - COEFFICIENT USED TO DETERMINE WHICH SUBINTERVAL A VALUE OF X IS IN.
        NALM - THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OF SUBINTERVALS FOR WHICH ARRAY SPACE HAS BEEN ALLOCATED.
        NFUN - NUMBER OF FUNCTIONS TO BE FITTED(SIMULTANEOUSLY,I.E. ALL FUNCTIONS HAVE THE SAME XFUN AND SUBINTERVALS, AND ALL ARE REQUIRED TO BE FIT WITH MAX REL ERR[EP]
        AF - ARRAYS OF COEFFICIENTS USED TO GET VALUES OF THE FUNCS.
        BF - ARRAYS OF COEFFICIENTS USED TO GET VALUES OF THE FUNCS.
        VFUNS - SUBROUTINE TO FILL AN ARRAY WITH THE VALUES OF THE FUNCTIONS TO BE FITTED.

      • QFIT

        public static boolean QFIT(int NJ,
                           double XL,
                           double XH,
                           double XR,
                           double EP,
                           double[] ZTHR,
                           double[] ZEP,
                           double REM,
                           int NJP,
                           java.lang.String XFUN,
                           java.lang.String XFI,
                           java.lang.String AX,
                           java.lang.String BX,
                           int NALM,
                           int NFUN,
                           java.lang.String AF,
                           java.lang.String BF,
                           java.lang.String VFUNS,
                           int IPRN)
        Called by PWLF1. CONSTRUCT THE INTERVAL COEFFICIENTS. XR SHOULD BE IN THE INTERVAL (XL,XH). IF NOT IT WILL BE SE TO THE NEAREST LIMIT. SUBINTERVALS WILL BE ARRANGED SO THAT XR IS ALWAYS ON A SUBINTERVAL BOUNDARY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS FEATURE IS TO MORE EASILY FIT FUNCTIONS WHICH HAVE AN INTERIOR DISCONTINUITY IN SLOPE. EXAMPLES ARE THE MOLLER AND PAIR CROSS SECTIONS WHICH CONTRIBUTE DISCONTINUITIES IN SLOPE TO THE ELECTRON AND PHOTON INTERACTION PROBABILITIES IN THE INTERIOR OF THE ENERGY RANGES FOR THESE PARTICLES.

        IN ABLE TO GIVE SOME VALUE FOR X'S WHICH MAY LIE SLIGHTLY OUTSIDE THE INTERVAL (XL,XH) AN EXTRA SUBINTERVAL ON EACH SIDE OF (XL,XH) IS PROVIDED, WHICH USED THE SAME STRAIGHT LINES AS THE ADJACENT INCLUDED SUBINTERVAL. NJ IS THE TOTAL NUMBER OF SUBINTERVALS AND NI IS DEFINED TO BE THE NUMBER OF INTERNAL SUBINTERVALS=NJ-2. NJP IS THE MINUMUM NUMBER OF POINTS INTERIOR TO THE INTERVAL (XL,XH) AT WHICH THE FIT IS TO BE TESTED. A NUMBER NIP WILL BE CHOSEN AS THE NUMBER OF INTERIOR POINTS WITHIN EACH SUBINTERVAL AT WHICH TO TEST SO THAT NIP*NI=NJP.

        Parameters:
        NJ - NJ
        XL - XL
        XH - XH
        XR - XR
        EP - EP
        ZTHR - ZTHR
        ZEP - ZEP
        REM - REM
        NJP - NJP
        XFUN - XFUN
        XFI - XFI
        AX - AX
        BX - BX
        NALM - NALM
        NFUN - NFUN
        AF - AF
        BF - BF
        VFUNS - VFUNS
        IPRN - IPRN
        Returns:
        the result
